reqs:
Pre-reqs: One of EECE 269, ELEC 221, STAT 305. (STAT 305 may be taken concurrently, with registration assistance from Electrical and Computer Engineering Student Services.)
Equivalents: STAT 321
description: Stochastic behaviour of signals and systems; discrete and continuous probability; random processes; modeling and identification of linear time-invariant systems; binary hypothesis testing and decision making. Credit will be granted for only one of ELEC 321 or STAT 357.
